GameGrid¶

class gamegridp.gamegrid.GameGrid(title, cell_size=32, columns=8, rows=8, margin=0, background_color=(255, 255, 255), cell_color=(0, 0, 0), img_path=None, img_action='upscale', speed=60, toolbar=False, console=False, actionbar=True)[Quellcode]¶

The Main GameGrid.

act()[Quellcode]¶

Should be overwritten in sub-classes. Act is called in every cycle of the mainloop

actors¶

returns all actors in grid :return: a list of all actors

add_actor(actor, location=None)[Quellcode]¶

Adds an actor to the grid. The method is called when a new actor is created.

cell_margin¶

returns the margin between cells

cell_rect(cell: tuple)[Quellcode]¶

gets the rectangle which describes the given cell

cell_to_pixel(cell: tuple)[Quellcode]¶

gets the top-left point of a cell

collision(partner1, partner2)[Quellcode]¶

overwritten by main_method :return:

columns¶

returns the margin between cells

draw()[Quellcode]¶

draws the entire window with grid, actionbar and toolbar :return:

frame¶

Returns the actual frame :return: the value of actual frame

get_actors_at_location(location: tuple, class_name: str = '') → list[Quellcode]¶

Get all actors at a specific location

listen(event: str = None, data=None)[Quellcode]¶

should be overwritten in sub classes :param event: The event which was triggered (e.g. mouse-left, key, mouse-right, button… :param data: The data submitted by the event (e.g. cell-location

remove_actor(actor=None, cell: tuple = None)[Quellcode]¶

Removes actor from grid :param actor: Removes the actor from the grid :param cell: Removes all actors in one cell from the grid :return:

remove_all_actors()[Quellcode]¶

remove all actors from the grid

repaint_area(rect: pygame.Rect)[Quellcode]¶

Repaints area on next update :param rect: The rectangle which should be redrawn

reset()[Quellcode]¶

resets the grid: Sets all actors to their starting positions. May not work if custom variables where set

rows¶

returns the margin between cells

setup()[Quellcode]¶

should be overwritten in sub_classes

show()[Quellcode]¶

Starts the mainloop
